https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks, and is labeled with `awaiting-review`.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]
-->

### PR summary [eda5c2077d](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/14503/commits/eda5c2077db6372fcb04cf3935ea4bface054cb2)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|
| `Mathlib.RingTheory.SimpleRing.Defs`|582|
| `Mathlib.RingTheory.SimpleRing.Basic`|620|

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ IsSimpleRing`
`+ eq_top`
`+ instance [IsSimpleRing R] : IsSimpleOrder (TwoSidedIdeal R) := IsSimpleRing.simple`
`+ instance [Nontrivial R] : Nontrivial (TwoSidedIdeal R) := by`
`+ instance [simple : IsSimpleRing R] : Nontrivial R := by`
`+ instance _root_.DivisionRing.isSimpleRing (A : Type*) [DivisionRing A] : IsSimpleRing A`
`+ isField_center`
`+ isSimpleRing_iff_isField`
`+ of_eq_bot_or_eq_top`
`+ one_mem`
`+ one_mem_iff`
`+ one_mem_of_ne_bot`
`+ one_mem_of_ne_zero_mem`

</details>

</details>

:v: jjaassoonn can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).
bors merge

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/10948353780/job/30399185549)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/10948353780/job/30399186112)
Thanks for working on this two-sided ideal material.

1 more minor comment

bors d+
Thanks for working on this two-sided ideal material.

1 more minor comment

bors d+
I guess the name is fine but perhaps `_root_.DivisionRing.isSimpleRing`?
Swap the `iff` or change the name?
`isField_center`

I know I have extreme views on this, but I would split out a `Defs` file with only this import, and then the results in another file. 

One should be able to talk about a simple ring without knowing `IsField`.
I had to include `import Mathlib.Order.Atoms` as well for otherwise, lean won't know what `IsSimpleOrder` is

```suggestion
import Mathlib.Algebra.Field.Equiv
```
This will allow a golf of the final result.

```suggestion
instance [IsSimpleRing R] : IsSimpleOrder (TwoSidedIdeal R) := IsSimpleRing.simple

instance nontrivial [simple : IsSimpleRing R] : Nontrivial R := by
  obtain ⟨x, hx⟩ := SetLike.exists_of_lt (bot_lt_top : (⊥ : TwoSidedIdeal R) < ⊤)
  have h (hx : x = 0) : False := by simp_all [TwoSidedIdeal.zero_mem]
  use x, 0, h
```

```suggestion
lemma one_mem_of_ne_bot {A : Type*} [NonAssocRing A] [IsSimpleRing A] (I : TwoSidedIdeal A)
    (hI : I ≠ ⊥) : (1 : A) ∈ I :=
  (eq_bot_or_eq_top I).resolve_left hI ▸ ⟨⟩
```

```suggestion
lemma of_eqBotOrEqTop [Nontrivial R] (h : ∀ I : TwoSidedIdeal R, I = ⊥ ∨ I = ⊤) :
    IsSimpleRing R where
  simple := { eq_bot_or_eq_top := h }

instance _root_.DivisionRing.isSimpleRing (A : Type*) [DivisionRing A] : IsSimpleRing A :=
  .of_eqBotOrEqTop <| fun I ↦ by
    rw [or_iff_not_imp_left]
    intro H
    suffices mem : 1 ∈ I from eq_top_iff.2 <| fun x _ ↦ mul_one x ▸ I.mul_mem_left x _ mem
    obtain ⟨x, hx1, hx2 : x ≠ 0⟩ := SetLike.exists_of_lt (bot_lt_iff_ne_bot.mpr H : ⊥ < I)
    simpa [inv_mul_cancel hx2] using I.mul_mem_left x⁻¹ _ hx1
```

```suggestion
  mul_comm := mul_comm
  mul_inv_cancel := by
    rintro ⟨x, hx1⟩ hx2
    rw [Subring.mem_center_iff] at hx1
    replace hx2 : x ≠ 0 := by simpa [Subtype.ext_iff] using hx2
    -- Todo: golf the following `let` once `TwoSidedIdeal.span` is defined
```

```suggestion
  ⟨fun _ ↦ by
    apply Subring.topEquiv.symm.toMulEquiv.isField
    rw [← Subring.center_eq_top A]
    exact isField_center A,
  fun h ↦ letI := h.toField; inferInstance⟩
```
Or `⊥` and `⊤` instead? Especially because `⟨1⟩` is not valid Lean syntax for a `TwoSidedIdeal`, right?
ditto

```suggestion
- `DivisionRing.isSimpleRing`: division rings are simple.
```

The bit after `<|` should be factored out as a (collection of) lemmas. That is, we should have:
```lean
namespace TwoSidedIdeal

lemma one_mem_iff : 1 ∈ I ↔ I = ⊤ := sorry
alias ⟨eq_top, one_mem⟩ := one_mem_iff
```
done

```suggestion
lemma of_eq_bot_or_eq_top [Nontrivial R] (h : ∀ I : TwoSidedIdeal R, I = ⊥ ∨ I = ⊤) :
```

or just don't name it.
```suggestion
instance instNontrivial [simple : IsSimpleRing R] : Nontrivial R := by
```
done

```suggestion
end IsSimpleRing

lemma isSimpleRing_iff_isField (A : Type*) [CommRing A] : IsSimpleRing A ↔ IsField A :=
  ⟨fun _ ↦ by
    apply Subring.topEquiv.symm.toMulEquiv.isField
    rw [← Subring.center_eq_top A]
    exact isField_center A,
  fun h ↦ letI := h.toField; inferInstance⟩
```
